1:
When I was distressed, I called out to Yahweh\q2 and he answered me.
\q1
2:
I prayed,\q2 "Yahweh, rescue me from those who lie to me and try to deceive me!"



\q1
3:
You people who lie to me, I will tell you what God will do to you\q2 and what he will do to punish you.
\q1
4:
He will punish you when soldiers shoot sharp arrows at you;\q2 arrows that were hardened and made sharp
\q2 over hot coals from the wood of a broom tree.



\q1
5:
It is terrible for me, living among cruel people\q2 like those who live in the regions of Meshech or Kedar.
\q1
6: I have lived for a long time among people who hate to live with others peacefully.\q1
7: Every time I talk about living together peacefully,\q2 they talk about starting a war.
